__TOC__

This page holds contact information on the various <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetRelayChat|IRC]]</nowiki> bots running in <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetRelayChat#Channels|Ubuntu IRC channels]]</nowiki> and some Ubuntu related channels. Please add your bot to this list.

=== ubuntulog Terms ===

ubuntulog can be joined to official project channels to provide official Ubuntu logging, which will appear on <nowiki>[[http://irclogs.ubuntu.com|Ubuntu's official irclogs page]]</nowiki>. You can ask for ubuntulog to be added to any official Ubuntu by emailing the request to rt@ubuntu.com. If ubuntulog is present in your channel, you must add the following entry message, or a translated version of the message, via Chan``Serv:

<pre>
Welcome to #channel. This channel is publicly logged at irclogs.ubuntu.com. Use of this channel implies acceptance of the terms at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/TermsOfService
</pre>

Some translated versions of the <nowiki>[[IRC-TermsOfService|Terms of Service]]</nowiki> are also available <nowiki>[[IRC-TermsOfService#Translations|here]]</nowiki>. The owner(s) of the channel also add the message with the following command:

<pre>
/msg ChanServ SET #channel ENTRYMSG Welcome to #channel. This channel is publicly logged at irclogs.ubuntu.com. Use of this channel implies acceptance of the terms at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/TermsOfService
</pre>

You can modify the contents entry message if necessary, as long as you clearly get across the fact that the channel is being logged and that use of the channel implies acceptance of the terms at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/TermsOfService. LoCo teams are encouraged to translate that page if required.

=== Info Bot Channels ===
There are different bots for different channels. If you need a bot in your Ubuntu or related channel, you can ask from the bot maintainers in #ubuntu-bots.

The current policy for which bot goes to which channel is as follows:

* <nowiki>[[#ubottu|ubottu]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/IrcTeam/Scope|Core channels]]</nowiki> (+ a few selected extras)
* <nowiki>[[#lubotu|lubotu]]</nowiki> -> LoCo channels
/* *<nowiki>[[#ubot5|ubot5]]</nowiki> -> External, but Ubuntu related, IRC channels */
* <nowiki>[[#ubot93|ubot93]]</nowiki> -> Ubuntu IRC channels; External, but Ubuntu related IRC channels.

=== External Bots ===

The <nowiki>[[IRC-IrcCouncil|IRC Council]]</nowiki> may also grant external public log bots to log certain channels, on the following conditions:
* Channel has 'Ubuntu``Irc``Council' as contact with chanserv.
* Channel is already logged at irclogs.ubuntu.com by 'ubuntulog'.
* The bot satisfies all libera.chat rules and guidelines, is not anonymized and is easily identifiable by nickname.
Please make sure you contact the <nowiki>[[IRC-IrcCouncil|IRC Council]]</nowiki> before your bot joins any channels.
